meanings.definition: The basic or inherent features of something
meanings.sent1: The natures of the animals in the forest vary greatly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the natures of different plants to understand their growth patterns.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how the natures of cats and dogs can be so different yet they get along.
meanings.sent4: The natures of the two siblings were like night and day, always contrasting.
meanings.sent5: The natures of the flowers in the garden bloomed beautifully in the spring.

meanings.definition: The physical world and its phenomena
meanings.sent1: Exploring the natures of the oceans reveals amazing creatures.
meanings.sent2: The natures of the mountains are majestic and awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent3: The natures of the planets in our solar system are truly fascinating.
meanings.sent4: The natures of the stars in the night sky shine brightly above us.
meanings.sent5: The natures of the forests hold many mysteries waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: The essential qualities or character of a person or thing
meanings.sent1: Her kind and caring natures make her a great friend to have.
meanings.sent2: The natures of honesty and integrity are valued in any relationship.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how the natures of laziness and productivity can coexist in one person.
meanings.sent4: The natures of courage and fear battled within him as he faced his fears.
meanings.sent5: The natures of the old house whispered stories of the past to those who listened.
